1: David charged with ambition and greedy desire to reign, protesteth his humility and modesty before God, and teacheth all men what they should do. Lord, [a]mine heart is not haughty, neither are mine eyes lofty, neither have I walked in great [b]matters and hid from me.
2: Surely I have behaved myself, like one weaned from his mother, and kept silence: I am in myself as one that is [c]weaned.
3: Let Israel wait on the Lord from henceforth and forever.
